subject: Golf
lead_paragraph: R. W. Eaks was the runaway winner in the Champions Tour 3M Championship in Blaine, Minn., posting the lowest score in the tournament’s 16-year history. Eaks shot a seven-under 65 in the final round to finish with a 54-hole total of 193, four shots better than Ed Dougherty’s finish in 2000. Gary Hallberg and Bernhard Langer tied for second at 199.
